meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

div.p: MSTest is a command line utility from Microsoft that executes unit tests created in Visual Studio 2005, Visual Studio 2008, or Visual Studio 2010.

This command has several options you can use to customize your test run. You can use many of these options in conjunction with one another; in fact, you must use certain options in conjunction with others, as described in the following sections. MSTest does not interpret the options nor the values you specify for them in a case-sensitive manner.
More information can be found at MSTest.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the MSTest tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.

@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin includes the most important features provided by the MSTest tool, also allows some extra funcionality to make the test more configurable according to specific needs. This plugin does not include options to print the labels, identifiers, descriptions, amoung others since they do not represent important information and would make the output less clear.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes or radio buttons, hitorical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested against version present on Visual Studio 2008.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

This procedure allows the input of all necessary parameters along with some extra of them to make the test more configurable. When the parameters are defined the MSTest test command is created and run into the Commander, displaying at the end the result(s) of it. It displays a summary, which updates while the test is running, of the failed and passed test(s), this is also a link to the specific failed test(s) to know where and which one failed. It also creates a log file, which contains the output generated by the console.

There are dependent fields, which are 'MSTest File Name' and 'Test List' because the use of a Test List is only allowed if the file extension is 'vsmdi', otherwise the 'Test File' field will be ignored. When the file extension is '.dll' ' /testcontainer:' command-line option will be used and when the file extension is 'vsmdi' ' /testmetadata:' command-line option will be used.

tr.td: Supply the path and name of the file that will be tested. Allowed extensions are .dll or .vsmdi.(This can be one of this two command-line options ' /testcontainer:' or ' /testmetadata:', depending on the extension of the file provided)(Required)
Supply the path and name of the MSTest.exe file.(This is the command-line '/resultsfile:' option)(Required)

Supply the path and name of the file where results will be saved.
-No results file specified: A default results file is saved in the given working directory.
-Just the name specified: The file is saved in the working directory with the given name.
-Name and path specified: The file is saved in the given path with the given name.(This is the command-line '/resultsfile:' option)
Specify a run configuration file to use. (This is the command-line ' /runconfig:' option)
Specify one or more individual tests to be run. If you specify more than one test, separate them with a space. (This is the command-line ' /test:' option)
Supply the test list, as specified in the metadata file, to be run. This option works only if the MSTest File Name extension is ".vsmdi". (This is the command-line ' /testlist:' option)
Specify the type of test, possible values could be: Unit Test, N Test, among others. (This is the command-line ' /detail:testtype' option)
Write the message shown by Console.Writeline() that is present in test code. (This is the command-line ' /detail:stdout' option)

ul.li: Procedure name(s) were changed in the step picker section
Changed properties to make parameters display properly.
